Idiom (Fula): Ko ɗum waɗi haŋki ɗum waɗi kadi
Figurative Meaning: What is meant to happen will surely happen
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Common among Fulɓe pastoralists expressing faith in destiny
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Fula): ko ɗum waːɗi haŋki ɗum waːɗi kaɗi
First Example Sentence: Ko ɗum waɗi haŋki ɗum waɗi kadi, hay so fow yoƴii ɗum.
Second Example Sentence: Ndee no woni, ko ɗum waɗi haŋki ɗum waɗi kadi.
Third Example Sentence: Ɗum waɗi kadi, ko ɗum waɗi haŋki ɗum waɗi kadi, waɗa ko Alla jaɓi.

Figurative Meaning: Every day brings its own troubles or blessings
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Fulɓe saying about patience and acceptance of fate
First Example Sentence: Ñalnde mari haɓɓu, min waɗa sabbu ɗum.
Second Example Sentence: Ko o wi’i, ñalnde mari haɓɓu, sabbu woni ko aduna.
Third Example Sentence: Ñalnde mari haɓɓu, ɗum wondi no moƴƴi ɗum ɗoɗi.

Non-Idiomatic Equivalent: It’s hard to accept but true
Usage Contexts: Serious talk, politics, debate, family discussion
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Reflects Fulɓe emphasis on honesty and dignity
First Example Sentence: Ɗum no teddungal ka ñala, hara ko min waɗi fow.
Second Example Sentence: Ɗum no teddungal ka ñala, amma ko feere mi waɗi ɗum.
Third Example Sentence: Mi yi'i ɗum, ɗum no teddungal ka ñala, mi waɗi sabbu.

Idiom (Fula): Ko ɗum ɓuri ko ɗum waɗi
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent: Deeds are more important than talk
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Fulɓe proverb emphasizing integrity through deeds
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Fula): ko ɗum ɓuɾi ko ɗum waːɗi
First Example Sentence: Ko ɗum ɓuri ko ɗum waɗi, wakkati woni ko huunde.
Second Example Sentence: Ko ɗum ɓuri ko ɗum waɗi, waɗi ɗum, haanɓe yiɗi ɗum.
Third Example Sentence: Ko ɗum ɓuri ko ɗum waɗi, waɗa ɗum, ɗum wondi fota.

Figurative Meaning: If we unite, our strength grows
First Example Sentence: Mbele min jippu, laamu njippu, no ɗum woni alaa heɓa.
Second Example Sentence: Ɗum waɗi no min jippu, laamu njippu ɗum yoƴi.
Third Example Sentence: Mbele min jippu, laamu njippu, waɗi moƴƴere haa kala.

Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Common Fulɓe proverb expressing realism and humility
First Example Sentence: Haako ɗum mbaawi waɗude toɓɓere, ɗum wondi ɗum ɗum.
Second Example Sentence: Ɗum no foti, haako ɗum mbaawi waɗude toɓɓere.
Third Example Sentence: Ɗum waɗi no mi yi'i, haako ɗum mbaawi waɗude toɓɓere.

Idiom (Fula): Ko njahdu waɗi, ko njaɓɓude waɗi
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Reflects Fulɓe value of hard work and perseverance
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Fula): ko ɲahdu waːɗi ko ɲaɓɓude waːɗi
First Example Sentence: Ko njahdu waɗi, ko njaɓɓude waɗi, ɗum no woni ɗum ɗum.
Second Example Sentence: Ɗum waɗi njaɓɓude, ɗum waɗi njahdu, ɗum no ɗum.
Third Example Sentence: Ko njahdu waɗi, ko njaɓɓude waɗi, min waɗi no waɗa.

Idiom (Fula): Ɗum ɗo fow toɓɓere ɗo miijje
Figurative Meaning: People talk about everything they see
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Draws from Fulɓe cultural sensitivity to reputation and speech
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Fula): ɗum ɗo fow toɓɓeɾe ɗo miːʝe
First Example Sentence: Ɗum ɗo fow toɓɓere ɗo miijje, hara ɗum ɗum.
Second Example Sentence: Ɗum ɗo miijje, ɗum ɗo fow toɓɓere ɗo miijje.
Third Example Sentence: Ko ɗum ɗo toɓɓere ɗo miijje, ɗum ɗum waɗi ɗum ɗum.

Idiom (Fula): Ko fii woyla, ɗum no waɗi hakke
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Ancient Fulɓe maxim about justice and accountability
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Fula): ko fiː woːjla ɗum no waːɗi hakːe
First Example Sentence: Ko fii woyla, ɗum no waɗi hakke, no ɗum waɗi ko ɗum.
Second Example Sentence: Ɗum waɗi hakke, ko fii woyla ɗum waɗi ɗum.
Third Example Sentence: Ko fii woyla, ɗum no waɗi hakke, waɗa ɗum ɗum.

Idiom (Fula): Ɗum waɗi ɗum waɗi, ɗum waɗi ɗum waɗi
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Fulɓe reflection on fate and patience
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Fula): ɗum waːɗi ɗum waːɗi ɗum waːɗi ɗum waːɗi
First Example Sentence: Ɗum waɗi ɗum waɗi, ɗum waɗi ɗum waɗi, no ɗum woni Alla.
Second Example Sentence: Ɗum waɗi ɗum waɗi, min waɗa sabbu.
Third Example Sentence: Ɗum waɗi ɗum waɗi, ko Alla waɗi ɗum ɗum.
